title: Josep Maria Vallès
text:
Josep Maria Vallès i Casadevall (born July 1940 in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>) is a Spanish academic and politician.
Career.
Vallès studied <a href="law">law</a> (<a href="Universitat%20de%20Barcelona">UB</a>), <a href="Political%20Science">Political Science</a> (IEP, in <a href="Paris">Paris</a>) and <a href="Business%20Management">Business Management</a> (<a href="ESADE">ESADE</a>, <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>). He is Emeritus Professor in <a href="Political%20Science">Political Science</a> and <a href="Administration%20%28business%29">Administration</a> in the <a href="Universitat%20Aut%C3%B2noma%20de%20Barcelona">Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona</a>, where he was Dean of the Faculty of <a href="Political%20Sciences">Political Sciences</a> and <a href="Sociology">Sociology</a> (1985–1990) and Rector (Vice-Chancellor) (1990–1994). Vallès has been President of the Spanish Association of Political Science and Administration (AECPA) and member of the Executive Board of the European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR). His research interests have been electoral systems and behaviour, local government and public policy. Vallès was elected to the <a href="Parliament%20of%20Catalonia">Parliament of Catalonia</a> in <a href="1999%20Catalonian%20parliamentary%20election">1999</a> and re-elected in <a href="2003%20Catalonian%20parliamentary%20election">2003</a>, as Barcelona candidate for Ciutadans pel Canvi (CpC), a civic association. In 2003, he was appointed Minister of Justice in the Catalan Government presided by Pasqual Maragall. Vallès is married and has two sons (Oriol and Màrius).
